gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਕਰ ਸੁ ਗਰਬੁ ਸੁਣ ਮੂੜ ਮਤ ਗਰਬ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਘਨੇਰ ਘਰ ||
transliteration: Jin Kar Su Gadab(u) Soun Moond Mat Gadab Gadaae Ghaner Ghar||
translation: Angad says, “O Ravana, do not be egoistic, this ego has destroyed many houses.”

gurmukhi: ਬਸ ਕਰੇ ਸਰਬ ਘਰ ਗਰਬ ਹਮ ੲੇ ਕਿਨ ਮਹਿ ਦ੍ਵੈ ਦੀਨ ਨਰ ||੩੭੬||
transliteration: Bas Dare Sarab Ghar Gadab Ham E Kin Maih Dvai Deen Nar||376||
translation: Ravana replies. “I am proud because I have brought under control all with my own power, then what power these two human beings Ram and Lakshman can wield.”376.
Speech of Ravana addressed to Angad :

gurmukhi: ਅਗਨ ਪਾਕ ਕਹ ਕਰੈ ਪਵਨ ਮੁਰ ਬਾਰ ਬੁਹਾਰੈ ||
transliteration: Agad Paak Kah Darai Pavan Mur Baar Boutdareeai||
translation: The god of fire is my cook and the god of wind is my sweeper,

gurmukhi: ਚਵਰ ਚੰਦ੍ਰਮਾ ਧਰੈ ਸੂਰ ਛੱਤ੍ਹਿ ਸਿਰ ਢਾਰੈ ||
transliteration: Chavar Channdramaa Ddarai Soor Chhattrah(i) Sir Ddareeai||
translation: The moon-god swings the fly-whisk over my head and the sun-god wields the canopy over my head;

gurmukhi: ਮਦ ਲਛਮੀ ਪਿਅਾਵੰਤ ਬੇਦ ਮੁਖ ਬ੍ਹਮ ੳੁਚਾਰਤ ||
transliteration: Mad Lachhmipiaavant Bed Moukh Brahm Oucdareeai||
translation: Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth, serves drinks to me and Brahma recites the Vedic mantras for me.

gurmukhi: ਬਰਨ ਬਾਰ ਨਿਤ ਭਰੇ ਅੌਰ ਕੁਲੁਦੇਵ ਜੁਹਾਰਤ ||
transliteration: Baran Baar Nit Bhare Aur Kuludev Juhaarat||
translation: Varuna is my water-carrier and pays obeisance in front of my family-god;

gurmukhi: ਨਿਜ ਕਹਤਿ ਸੁ ਬਲ ਦਾਨਵ ਪ੍ਰਬਲ ਦੇਤ ਧਨੁਦਿ ਜਛ ਮੋਹਿ ਕਰ ||
transliteration: Nij Kahat(i) Su Bal Daanav Prabal Det Dhanud(i) Jachh Moh(i) Kar||
translation: This is my whole power-formation, besides them all the demon-forces are with me, for which reason the Yakshas etc. gladly present present all types of their wealth to me.

gurmukhi: ਵੇ ਜੁੱਧ ਜੀਤ ਤੇ ਜਾਂਹਿਗੇ ਕਹਾਂ ਦੋੲਿ ਤੇ ਦੀਨ ਨਰ ||੩੭੭||
transliteration: Ve Juddh Jeet Te Jaanhege Kahaan Doe Te Deen Nar||377||
translation: The person about whom you are talking, both of them are very low and helpless men, how shall then they win the war?377.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਿ ਹਾਰਯੋ ਕਪਿ ਕੋਟਿ ਦੲੀਤ ਪਤਿ ੲੇਕ ਨ ਮਾਨੀ ||
transliteration: Kah(i) Hdaryo Kap(i) Kop(i) Daeet Pat(i) Ek Na Maanee||
translation: Angad, the monkey-chief, advice Ravana several times, but he did not accept his advice.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਠਤ ਪਾਵ ਰੁਪਿਯੋ ਸਭਾ ਮਧਿ ਸੋ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੀ ||
transliteration: Outhat Paav Roupiyo Sabhaa Madh(i) So Abhimaanee||
translation: When he got up, he firmly planted his foot in the assembly and challenged them to remove his foot (from the floor);

gurmukhi: ਥਕੇ ਸਕਲ ਅਸੁਰਾਰ ਪਾਵ ਕਿਨਹੂੰ ਨ ੳੁੱਚਕਯੋ ||
transliteration: Thake Sakal Asuraar Paav Kinhoon Na Ouchchadyo||
translation: None of the demons could do that and accepted defeat;

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰੇ ਧਰਨ ਮੁਰਛਾੲਿ ਬਿਮਨ ਦਾਨਵ ਦਲ ਥੱਕਯੋ ||
transliteration: Gire Dharan Murchhaad Biman Daanav Dal Thakkyo||
translation: Many of them fell down unconscious because of their spent-up strength.
